Sir, LIGHTHOUSE TELDER 'NEARCHUS” AT BASRAH, IRA*}. We beg to inform you that we have received telegraphic communication from our Basrah House, Messrs. E. Suren (Basrah) Ltd., that the Port authorities wish to convert the above vessel, which is of 1,000 tons displacement, from a 600 shaft h.p. to Diesel a They inform us in the telegram that this vessel was built in 1914 and supplied to Basrah through your Department, and we are asked to approach you with a view to obtaining the plans of the vessel, so that we can make arrangements for the conversion. physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter between E Surén, London, and the Under-Secretary General for India. Surén was requesting for plans of the lighthouse tender Nearchusat Basra, which were not available.
